    • Method Detail

      • handleInterval

        private int handleInterval(int time)
        If the current time matches the job creation time, creates a new job, otherwise creates a new interval if one is not active.
        Parameters:
        time - number of seconds the simulation has been running
        Returns:
        1 if create job time is the current time, 0 if this value has not been reached
        See Also:
        createNewInterval(int)

      • createNewInterval

        private void createNewInterval(int time)
        Sets the interval of time in seconds until a new print task will be created.
        Parameters:
        time - number of seconds the simulation has been running
        See Also:
        handleInterval(int), jobCreationTime

      • simOneSecond

        private void simOneSecond(int second)
        Runs one second of the simulation, if jobs are in the queue, any free servers begin service on the first one in queue. If it is time for a job to endService the server does so, and all cumulative statistical variables are updated.
        Parameters:
        second - the time in seconds that the method is simulating
        See Also:
        currentTime

      • setServers

        private void setServers()
        Resets the servers to the correct amount and into their unaltered states.
        See Also:
        resetValues()

        Parameters:

        setJButtons(boolean)

        See Also:

      • lockJButtonActionPerformed

        private void lockJButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Locks in the values the user wishes to use after Validating that all values are acceptable. Requires button press if simulation is to occur. In place to prevent accidental overwrites of simulation data.
        Parameters:
        evt - button press
        See Also:
        simOneSecond(int)

      • defaultValuesButtonActionPerformed

        private void defaultValuesButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Sets all value text fields to predetermined values in order to provide a quick and easy way to see an output that functions at a moderately efficient rate.
        Parameters:
        evt - button press
        See Also:
        lockJButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent)

      • editJButtonActionPerformed

        private void editJButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Enables the value text fields for editing. User is unable to edit the values or hit Lock until this is pressed. In place to prevent accidental simulation data overwrite.
        Parameters:
        evt - button press
        See Also:
        lockJButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent), simOneSecond(int)
